p: Perinatal transmission is a common source of infection in children. Adolescents may be exposed through intravenous or intranasal drug use and use of shared tattoo needles. The incidence of HCV vertical transmission is approximately 2–5 % in HCV RNA positive mothers, with the highest risk in mothers with high HCV viral load. The risk also is increased fourfold for mothers with a concomitant HIV coinfection [ 125– 130].
